jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi! I’m Val Bartlett, VP of Sales at TLDR.

If you’re reading this, you probably know what it takes to drive client retention and build partnerships that last. I’m hiring an Account Manager to join our growing team and own post-sale relationships across some of the biggest names in tech and media. You’ll work closely with me, our Account Management team, and cross-functional partners to deliver best-in-class campaigns that perform and grow.

Who We Are

TLDR is the largest network of tech newsletters in the world, with over 7M subscribers across topics like startups, software engineering, AI, cybersecurity, product, and more.

Our mission is to build the paper of record for technical fields - the trusted source people in tech rely on to understand what matters and why. With 40%+ open rates and a highly engaged audience, brands and agencies are calling newsletters the “challenger channel” and TLDR is leading the charge.

About the Role

We’re looking for a strategic, revenue-minded Account Manager who can own post-sale client relationships across a book of 70+ active accounts. You’ll ensure flawless campaign delivery, deepen client partnerships, and identify new opportunities for growth. This role is a mix of relationship management, strategic consulting, and data-driven performance analysis.

In this role, you will:

  • Own post-sale client relationships, ensuring satisfaction, retention, and growth.

  • Lead client onboarding, campaign management, and delivery in collaboration with Ad Ops.

  • Proactively identify renewal and upsell opportunities across your account base.

  • Analyze campaign performance, communicate insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.

  • Partner closely with Sales, Ops, and Ad Ops to streamline handoffs and improve execution.

  • Maintain accurate forecasting, pipeline, and account health data in HubSpot.

  • Prioritize your book of business by potential, ensuring the right level of service across accounts.

  • Surface process improvements and client insights to help shape TLDR’s product and sales strategy.

What Success Looks Like

  • 90%+ renewal rate across managed accounts.

  • 120%+ net revenue retention (NRR) within 12 months.

  • Consistent 10–20% quarterly upsell growth.

  • 98%+ on-time, error-free campaign delivery.

  • Clear, trusted forecasting and account reporting cadence.

  • Strong collaboration with AEs and Ad Ops on key accounts.

About You

  • 3+ years of Account Management or Client Success experience in digital media, advertising, or newsletters.

  • Proven track record of owning renewals, upsells, and revenue targets.

  • Strong understanding of campaign metrics, reporting, and optimization.

  • Proficient in CRM tools (HubSpot or equivalent) and revenue forecasting.

  • Exceptional communication and relationship management skills.

  • Comfortable managing a large, diverse book of business.

  • Collaborative, organized, and confident working autonomously.

What Makes an A+ Candidate

  • You’ve managed advertising or sponsorship campaigns end-to-end.

  • You balance empathy with commercial instincts — both client-first and performance-driven.

  • You thrive in high-growth, fast-moving environments with evolving processes.

  • You think like a partner, not a vendor — and can speak the language of tech and media.

  • You’re naturally curious, proactive, and driven to make things better.

You’re Not a Fit If You…

  • Haven’t worked in the media, advertising, or sponsorship space.

  • Need highly prescriptive direction or prefer narrowly defined responsibilities.

  • Don’t enjoy operating in ambiguity or startup environments.

  • Lack familiarity with the tech/startup ecosystem.

Why You'll Love It

  • Competitive base salary plus additional performance-based compensation

  • 100% Remote Company that shares a common goal

  • Annual team offsite. In 2024 we went to Colorado. Tell us where we should go next!

  • Unlimited PTO - most team members will enjoy 2-3 weeks off per year + holidays

  • 401(k) plan

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits with 100% paid option

  • Paid parental leave

  • Hardware stipend - we're on Macbook Pro M3s, get a new monitor, headset, chair on us

  • Learning & Development stipend - we are a curious group that believes in learning

  • Contemporary tech stack and tools

  • Autonomy and agency to contribute to the growth of one of the largest newsletters in the world.

📥 If you're ready to make a tremendous impact at a bootstrapped and profitable startup, please apply. Please let us know if you need any accommodation during any part of the interview process.

jobs.title: Agency Partnerships Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi! I’m Elyse Morris, Director of Agency Partnerships at TLDR.

We’re building TLDR’s agency channel from the ground up, and I’m looking for a smart, collaborative Agency Partnerships Manager to help shape it. You’ll be one of the first hires on this team, driving new agency relationships, opening doors, and helping us turn TLDR into the must-buy media partner for B2B advertisers.

Who We Are

TLDR is the largest network of tech newsletters in the world, with over 7M subscribers across topics like startups, software engineering, AI, cybersecurity, product, and more.

Our mission is to build the paper of record for technical fields - the trusted source people in tech rely on to understand what matters and why. With 40%+ open rates and a highly engaged audience, brands and agencies are calling newsletters the “challenger channel” and TLDR is leading the charge.

About the Role

You’ll own the end-to-end sales process with agencies, from prospecting to close, while collaborating closely with TLDR’s account executives. Your job is to expand our footprint inside the world’s top media agencies and drive meaningful revenue growth.

In this role, you will:

  • Prospect, pitch, and close new agency partnerships, building lasting relationships

  • Run incredible meetings from lunch-and-learns, to panel pitches, to strategic workshops that educate and inspire

  • Collaborate with AEs to co-sell, shape proposals, and accelerate deals

  • Map agency orgs and TAM to understand where we can win, and build plans to get there

  • Maintain CRM and data hygiene ensuring clarity on ownership and performance

  • Contribute to our playbook by refining how TLDR goes to market with agencies

  • Hit revenue goals and help establish agency as a leading channel for TLDR

What Success Looks Like

  • You’re running 3–5 high-quality agency meetings per week

  • You’re generating a steady stream of qualified RFPs and proposals

  • You’re influencing and accelerating revenue across multiple accounts

  • You’ve built complete relationship maps and TAM plans for key agencies

  • You’re a trusted, collaborative partner to AEs and leadership.

About You

  • 2–5 years in media, advertising, or agency partnerships

  • Experience owning a sales goal or revenue quota

  • Skilled prospector who loves opening new relationships

  • Clear, persuasive communicator and confident presenter

  • Agency-fluent: understands how agencies plan, buy, and measure media

  • Adaptable, curious, and collaborative - thrives in ambiguity and startup speed

  • Bonus: experience in newsletters, publisher-direct, or email media

What Makes an A+ Candidate

  • You already have agency relationships and can open doors on day one

  • You’ve closed meaningful partnerships in digital media and know how to drive revenue

  • You’re skilled at navigating complex org structures and influencing both planners and senior decision-makers

  • You have a proven track record of exceeding revenue targets

  • You’re entrepreneurial - helping write the playbook, not just follow one

You’re Not a Fit If You…

  • Haven’t worked in media, advertising, or agency partnerships

  • Need a lot of direction on how to build pipeline or manage accounts

  • Prefer large teams with lots of structure and layers

  • Don’t enjoy being both hunter and farmer in the same role

  • Lack curiosity about tech, media, and the changing digital landscape

Why You'll Love It

  • Competitive base salary plus additional performance-based compensation

  • 100% Remote Company that shares a common goal

  • Annual team offsite. In 2024 we went to Colorado. Tell us where we should go next!

  • Unlimited PTO - most team members will enjoy 2-3 weeks off per year + holidays

  • 401(k) plan

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits with 100% paid option

  • Paid parental leave

  • Hardware stipend - we're on Macbook Pro M3s, get a new monitor, headset, chair on us

  • Learning & Development stipend - we are a curious group that believes in learning

  • Contemporary tech stack and tools

  • Autonomy and agency to contribute to the growth of one of the largest newsletters in the world.

📥 If you're ready to make a tremendous impact at a bootstrapped and profitable startup, please apply. Please let us know if you need any accommodation during any part of the interview process.

jobs.title: Senior Growth Marketer, Paid Acquisition
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi! 👋 I'm Chris, Director of Marketing at TLDR.

We’re looking for a Senior Growth Marketer, Paid Acquisition to take our paid growth engine to the next level and drive meaningful growth across both our subscriber and advertiser funnels. You’ll be our paid media architect - experimenting, optimizing, and scaling campaigns while pioneering new channels and frameworks that redefine how we grow.

Who We Are

TLDR is the largest network of tech newsletters in the world, with over 7M subscribers across topics like startups, software engineering, AI, cybersecurity, product, and more.

Our mission is to build the paper of record for technical fields - the trusted source people in tech rely on to understand what matters and why. With 40%+ open rates and a highly engaged audience, brands and agencies are calling newsletters the “challenger channel” and TLDR is leading the charge.

About the Role

We’re scaling fast through both organic growth and paid acquisition. This role will own all paid efforts - driving performance, testing new channels, and creating scalable systems for continuous learning and optimization.

If you’re obsessed with metrics, thrive in experimentation, and get energized by turning $1 into $3, this is for you.

In this role, you will:

  • Own and optimize campaigns across Meta and LinkedIn

  • Manage 6-figure monthly budgets, improving efficiency and ROAS

  • Build a creative and channel testing framework to optimize CAC and subscriber/advertiser growth

  • Develop high-performing ad copy and creative using AI tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, Runway, etc.)

  • Identify and test new paid channels (Reddit, X, TikTok, podcasts, newsletters)

  • Partner with Sales on advertiser quality feedback and with Engineering/Product for site and conversion improvements

  • Help shape overall acquisition strategy

What Success Looks Like

  • Improved CAC and ROAS across Meta and LinkedIn

  • A structured testing and creative iteration framework in place

  • At least one new paid channel successfully piloted and scaled

  • Clear reporting cadence and transparency around performance

About You

  • 3+ years in performance marketing or paid acquisition

  • Hands-on experience managing $100K+/month budgets

  • Deep expertise in Meta Ads

  • Strong analytical mindset and experimentation philosophy

  • Experience with low-ticket, high-volume B2C or eCommerce-style growth

  • Proven results: e.g., reduced CAC or improved ROAS metrics

  • Excellent communicator; thrives in fast-paced, autonomous environments

What Makes an A+ Candidate

  • You’re metrics-obsessed and fluent in testing methodologies

  • You’ve scaled campaigns at high volume, not just high spend

  • You leverage AI tools to improve creative and performance

  • You can balance analytical precision with creative experimentation

  • You’re curious, proactive, and excited to experiment

  • You have experience manager Meta and LinkedIn Ads

You’re Not a Fit If You…

  • Primarily work in paid search without significant paid social experience

  • Come from environments with ultra-high budgets (8-figure+) and rigid teams

  • Have only managed small, local, or high-ticket niche campaigns

  • Prefer waiting for direction instead of iterating independently

Why You'll Love It

  • Own a critical growth lever at a profitable, fast-growing media company

  • Large budget + freedom to test bold ideas - no corporate red tape

  • Collaborate directly with leadership on growth strategy

  • Access to cutting-edge AI marketing tools

  • Competitive base salary plus additional performance-based compensation

  • 100% Remote Company that shares a common goal

  • Annual team offsite. In 2024 we went to Colorado. Tell us where we should go next!

  • Unlimited PTO - most team members will enjoy 2-3 weeks off per year + holidays

  • 401(k) plan

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits with 100% paid option

  • Paid parental leave

  • Hardware stipend - we're on Macbook Pro M3s, get a new monitor, headset, chair on us

  • Learning & Development stipend - we are a curious group that believes in learning

  • Contemporary tech stack and tools

  • Autonomy and agency to contribute to the growth of one of the largest newsletters in the world.

📥 If you're ready to make a tremendous impact at a bootstrapped and profitable startup, please apply. Please let us know if you need any accommodation during any part of the interview process.

jobs.title: Senior Growth Marketer, Lifecycle & Automation
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi! 👋 I'm Chris Chan, Director of Marketing at TLDR

We’re looking for a Senior Growth Marketer who can build TLDR’s lifecycle and automation programs from the ground up - designing, testing, and scaling the systems that turn interest into action.

Who We Are

TLDR is the largest network of tech newsletters in the world, with over 7M subscribers across topics like startups, software engineering, AI, cybersecurity, product, and more.

Our mission is to build the paper of record for technical fields - the trusted source people in tech rely on to understand what matters and why. With 40%+ open rates and a highly engaged audience, brands and agencies are calling newsletters the “challenger channel” and TLDR is leading the charge.

About the Role

We’re ready to take our growth marketing motion to the next level and you’ll lead that charge. As our Senior Growth Marketer (Lifecycle & Automation), you’ll rebuild and expand our lifecycle marketing programs, design data-driven nurture flows, and own outbound automation to drive high-quality sales conversations.

This is a high-impact, hands-on role ideal for someone who’s equal parts creative and analytical - a builder who can write killer copy, architect automated systems, and make decisions grounded in data.

In this role, you will:

  • Design and execute new lifecycle marketing programs for inbound prospects and inactive customers.

  • Segment and personalize messaging by audience.

  • Build and optimize automated outbound sequences using tools like HubSpot and Amplemarket

  • Collaborate closely with Sales and RevOps to align data, reporting, and lead flows

  • Maintain marketing database hygiene and continuously improve audience segmentation

  • Develop experiments to test copy, timing, triggers and workflows to maximize engagement

  • Report on key lifecycle and conversion metrics to guide optimization and growth

What Success Looks Like

  • You’ve launched multiple segmented lifecycle campaigns that meaningfully outperform our legacy sequences

  • Inbound prospects and inactive leads are re-engaging through your nurture flows on a predictable cadence

  • Outbound automation is driving measurable increases in qualified sales conversations

  • You’ve built scalable systems, reporting, and processes for sustained growth and continual experimentation

About You

  • 3+ years of experience in B2B growth or lifecycle marketing, ideally within SaaS, media, or agency environments targeting marketers.

  • Expert-level email marketing and copywriting skills - you write clearly, persuasively, and with purpose

  • Proficient in HubSpot Marketing Suite and familiar with outbound tools like Amplemarket, Outreach, or Apollo.

  • Analytical and data-driven. You’re comfortable building reports, identifying insights, and optimizing based on performance.

  • Collaborative, proactive, and comfortable working cross-functionally in a lean team.

  • Bonus: You’ve run your own newsletter or have a portfolio showcasing your writing and campaign work.

  • Bonus: Startup or growth-stage background - you thrive on ownership and execution.

What Makes an A+ Candidate

  • You’re both creative and analytical - a copywriter and a data-driven marketer in one.

  • You love to build from scratch and iterate based on what works.

  • You’ve run hands-on lifecycle and outbound programs that drive real results.

  • You balance thoughtful strategy with a bias for action.

You’re Not a Fit If You…

  • Want to focus only on strategy without execution

  • Depend on others for copywriting or automation setup

  • Need a large team or heavy structure to make progress.

Why You'll Love It

  • Competitive base salary plus additional performance-based compensation

  • 100% Remote Company that shares a common goal

  • Annual team offsite. In 2024 we went to Colorado. Tell us where we should go next!

  • Unlimited PTO - most team members will enjoy 2-3 weeks off per year + holidays

  • 401(k) plan

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits with 100% paid option

  • Paid parental leave

  • Hardware stipend - we're on Macbook Pro M3s, get a new monitor, headset, chair on us

  • Learning & Development stipend - we are a curious group that believes in learning

  • Contemporary tech stack and tools

  • Autonomy and agency to contribute to the growth of one of the largest newsletters in the world.

📥 If you're ready to make a tremendous impact at a bootstrapped and profitable startup, please apply. Please let us know if you need any accommodation during any part of the interview process.
